meanings.definition: Worthless rock or mineral material that is closely associated with valuable minerals in an ore deposit.
meanings.sent1: The gangue in the mine had no value compared to the shiny gold.
meanings.sent2: Miners had to separate the gangue from the precious gems to extract them.
meanings.sent3: The gangue tried to look important next to the diamonds, but everyone knew its true worth.
meanings.sent4: The gangue surrounded the treasure like a deceptive cloak, hiding the real riches within.
meanings.sent5: The gangue stood out like a dull pebble among the glittering jewels.

meanings.definition: A group of worthless or undesirable people.
meanings.sent1: The gangue of troublemakers caused chaos in the schoolyard.
meanings.sent2: She avoided the gangue of gossiping neighbors who always spread rumors.
meanings.sent3: The gangue of lazy workers always found a way to avoid doing their fair share.
meanings.sent4: The gangue of negativity clouded the team's chances of success.
meanings.sent5: He felt like part of the gangue of misfits, finding comfort in their shared quirks.
